body_html:
Yes, you have to take care of data splitting yourself. Shuffling should work fine -- unless you set the random seed in each of the threads.

I don't know what the loss is doing, I can imagine that it does all kinds of terrible things, for instance it may return all zeros, and only because you use gradient clipping do you even get a non-inf loss. I don't know. I'm pretty sure you didn't see valid data after the first epoch.
body_text:
Yes, you have to take care of data splitting yourself. Shuffling should work fine -- unless you set the random seed in each of the threads.
I don't know what the loss is doing, I can imagine that it does all kinds of terrible things, for instance it may return all zeros, and only because you use gradient clipping do you even get a non-inf loss. I don't know. I'm pretty sure you didn't see valid data after the first epoch.
body:
Yes, you have to take care of data splitting yourself. Shuffling should work fine -- unless you set the random seed in each of the threads.

I don't know what the loss is doing, I can imagine that it does all kinds of terrible things, for instance it may return all zeros, and only because you use gradient clipping do you even get a non-inf loss. I don't know. I'm pretty sure you didn't see valid data after the first epoch.
